channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Meeting Trump at White House, Zelenksyy hopes for continued aid in war with Russia
item.description: It's the first face-to-face meeting between Zelenskyy and Trump since Trump's inauguration, and it comes about a week after Trump called Zelenskyy a dictator and repeated Kremlin talking points, including suggesting that Ukraine started the war with Russia.
item.content:encoded:
It's the first face-to-face meeting between Zelenskyy and Trump since Trump's inauguration, and it comes about a week after Trump called Zelenskyy a dictator and repeated Kremlin talking points, including suggesting that Ukraine started the war with Russia.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Iowa has high cancer rates. Trump's cuts to CDC and NIH are already hitting the state
item.description: Iowa has the second highest incidence rate of cancer in the country, and it is already feeling Trump's cuts to the workforce and research institutions trying to solve the rural cancer problem.
item.content:encoded:
Iowa has the second highest incidence rate of cancer in the country, and it is already feeling Trump's cuts to the workforce and research institutions trying to solve the rural cancer problem.

(Image credit: Bri McNulty)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: As the Texas outbreak grows, how contagious is measles, really?
item.description: Vaccination eliminated measles from the U.S. 25 years ago. But it can still spread in pockets where vaccination rates are low, like the west Texas county with a current outbreak. Here's how fast.
item.content:encoded: Vaccination eliminated measles from the U.S. 25 years ago. But it can still spread in pockets where vaccination rates are low, like the west Texas county with a current outbreak. Here's how fast.
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Why the U.S. wants Ukraine's minerals. And AOC speaks with NPR's Steve Inskeep
item.description: Trump and Zelenskyy are expected to meet today in Washington, D.C., to sign a preliminary deal. And, AOC tells NPR why she believes the government only works for the wealthy.
item.content:encoded:
Trump and Zelenskyy are expected to meet today in Washington, D.C., to sign a preliminary deal. And, AOC tells NPR why she believes the government only works for the wealthy.

(Image credit: Evgeniy Maloletka)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Israeli military cites 'fundamental misunderstanding' of Hamas ahead of Oct. 7 attack
item.description: The report is the Israeli military's first official account of mistakes that preceded the 2023 attack, which launched Israel's subsequent war against Hamas in Gaza that killed more than 48,000 Palestinians.
item.content:encoded:
The report is the Israeli military's first official account of mistakes that preceded the 2023 attack, which launched Israel's subsequent war against Hamas in Gaza that killed more than 48,000 Palestinians.

(Image credit: Leo Correa)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Who's in charge of DOGE? (It's not these women. Or the owl.) Find out in the quiz
item.description: Which stores closed and which shows were canceled? Who (or what) was reborn after being hit by a Cybertruck? And is that asteroid going to hit us or what?
item.content:encoded: Which stores closed and which shows were canceled? Who (or what) was reborn after being hit by a Cybertruck? And is that asteroid going to hit us or what?
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: 1 thing that upended years of U.S. foreign policy â€” and other big Trump developments
item.description: Three years after Russia launched its invasion of Ukraine, the U.S., in a split with its European allies over the war, sided with Russia at the U.N.
item.content:encoded:
Three years after Russia launched its invasion of Ukraine, the U.S., in a split with its European allies over the war, sided with Russia at the U.N.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: In child care centers and on farms, businesses are bracing for more immigration raids
item.description: The Trump administration's immigration positions â€” including mass deportation â€” have put businesses that employ people without legal status on notice.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration's immigration positions â€” including mass deportation â€” have put businesses that employ people without legal status on notice.

(Image credit: Etienne Laurent)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Long ignored, Black modernist architects get recognition
item.description: Black architects who helped shape the modern architecture movement have often been overlooked. One effort preserves the structures they designed and tells their stories.
item.content:encoded:
Black architects who helped shape the modern architecture movement have often been overlooked. One effort preserves the structures they designed and tells their stories.

(Image credit: Elon Schoenholz)
item.dc:creator: Buffy Gorrilla

item.title: Why some EV buyers are getting their tax returns rejected this year
item.description: The federal EV tax credit, worth up to $7,500, saw big changes in 2024. For buyers, the credit typically became easier to get. But if their dealers skipped a step, it was a different story.
item.content:encoded:
The federal EV tax credit, worth up to $7,500, saw big changes in 2024. For buyers, the credit typically became easier to get. But if their dealers skipped a step, it was a different story.

(Image credit: David Zalubowski)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske
